body:
Since the attributes play a role in how an object is unpacked in signatures, it should be clearly known which public attributes an object has.

For example `Pair.Capture` uses `Mu.Capture` and unpacks with `\(:key<foo>, :value<bar>)`. But the documentation for `Pair` isn't all that clear on what attributes the type has.

I tried documenting them [just like methods](https://docs.perl6.org/type/IO::Path#attribute_CWD) except calling them `attribute`. In `IO::Handle`, [some of the attributes are documented as methods](https://docs.perl6.org/type/IO::Handle#method_encoding). And relying just on `.new` method's documentation isn't really great either, because [some .new methods have many options](https://docs.perl6.org/type/Date#method_new) and it's unclear which of them end up being attributes.
title: Need clear documentation of public attributes
